tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: This reads like a slope...so it should not be intrepreted as an intercept.

answers.text: There is an increase of $25,000 for each year of extra higher education.
The average salary of a person is $25,000

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Nice. You are correct. By $25,000 being the intercept of the relationship between salary and higher education, this value indicates the starting salary of a person that does not go to university...here are two tokens...u i

answers.text: The salary of a person that does not take any year of higher education is $25,000
The average year of higher education cost $25,000

question: If the relationship between salary (dependent variable) and years of higher education (independent variable) has an intercept of $25,000. what does that mean?
